  • Method
com.github.bwsoft.iris.message

Interface GroupObject


  • public interface GroupObject
    A GroupObject is a section in a message that is defined by a group. Use getDefinition() to obtain the definition for this message section. Use one of the set/get method to set/modify or retrieve the values of fields in this section. To get/set a value of a field in the group, do 
     
     // Obtain the handle to the GroupObject, typically from its parent GroupObject
     GroupObject groupObj = ...;
     
     // Get the definition of the GroupObject 
     Group group = (Group) groupObj.getDefinition();
     
     // Get the field by name
     Field aNumberField = group.getField("field-name");
     
     // Get the field by ID (preferred method)
     Field aByteArrayField = group.getField(id); 
     
     // Use one of the get method to obtain the value 
     Number aNumber = groupObj.getNumber(aNumberField);
     
     // Or use one of the set method to set the value
     groupObj.setBytes(aByteArrayField, srcByteArray, offset, length);
     ...
    Author:
    yzhou

    • Method Detail

      • getDefinition

        Field getDefinition()
        Obtain the definition of this group object.
        Returns:
        the definition of this group object.

      • getField

        Field getField(short id)
        Get the definition of a field that belongs to this group.
        Parameters:
        id - the field id
        Returns:
        the field definition or an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the field does not belong to this group.

      • getField

        Field getField(java.lang.String name)
        Get the definition of a field that belongs to this group.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the field
        Returns:
        the field definition or an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the field does not belong to this group.

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        The storage size of the current GroupObject. It does not include the size of header if there is.
        Returns:
        size of the value storage of this GroupObject

      • getBytes

        int getBytes(byte[] dest,
             int destOffset,
             int length)
        Retrieve this group object in its byte representation excluding its header.
        Parameters:
        dest - the destination buffer to hold bytes
        destOffset - offset in the buffer
        length - maximum length to retrieve
        Returns:
        number of bytes retrieved. It is the minimal between the length provided or the total available length.

      • getSize

        int getSize(Field field)
        The storage size of a child field. It does not include the size of header if there is. For a fixed size field, the size is equal to the size of the field type multiplied by its dimension. For a constant field, the size is zero. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the storage size of the field

      • getChar

        char getChar(Field field)
        This is an unprotected method to return a character value of a field in this group. The method will not check if the field type is CHAR. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is a constant field. Use getString(Field) to retrieve the value of a constant field.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the value of this field

      • setChar

        void setChar(Field field,
             char c)
        This is an unprotected method to set a character value to a field in this group. The method will not check if the field type is CHAR. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is a constant field. Use getString(Field) to retrieve the value of a constant field.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        c - value to be set

      • getNumber

        java.lang.Number getNumber(Field field)
        Return a number of this field. byte, I8, U8, I16 needs to have a short type at minimal. U16, I32 need to have an int as minimal. U32, I64, U64 requires a long type. Apply this method to other type of fields including constant field result in an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the value of this field

      • setNumber

        void setNumber(Field field,
               java.lang.Number value)
        Set a target field in this group with a number value. byte, I8, U8, I16 needs to have a short type at minimal. U16, I32 need to have an int as minimal. U32, I64, U64 requires a long type. Apply this method to other type of fields including constant field result in an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        value - value to be set

      • getU16

        int getU16(Field field)
        This is an unprotected method to return an integer value of a field in this group. This method can only be applied to fields of type U16. However the method does not validate the field type but assumes it is the responsibility of the application. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is a constant field. Use getString(Field) to retrieve the value of a constant field.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the value of this field

      • getChars

        int getChars(Field field,
             char[] dest,
             int destOffset,
             int length)
        This is an unprotected method to return a character array of a field in this group. The method will not check if the field type is CHAR. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is a constant field. Use getString(Field) to retrieve the value of a constant field.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        dest - the destination array to hold values
        destOffset - the destination array starting offset
        length - max attempted length to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the number of characters retrieved. It is the minimal between the length and the available length in the message.

      • setChars

        int setChars(Field field,
             char[] src,
             int srcOffset,
             int length)
        This is an unprotected method to set value to a character array of a field in this group. The method will not check if the field type is CHAR. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is a constant field. Use getString(Field) to retrieve the value of a constant field.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        src - the source array that contains value to be set
        srcOffset - the starting position in the source array
        length - the number of characters that are set.
        Returns:
        the number of characters retrieved. It is the minimal between the length and the available length in the message.

      • getBytes

        int getBytes(Field field,
             byte[] dest,
             int destOffset,
             int length)
        Return a byte array representation of the field. All types of fields can be converted into a byte array. It is purely the byte copy of the field content excluding the field header if there is any.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        dest - the destination array to hold values
        destOffset - the destination array starting offset
        length - max attempted length to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the number of bytes retrieved. It is the minimal between the length and the available length in the message.

      • setBytes

        int setBytes(Field field,
             byte[] src,
             int srcOffset,
             int length)
        Set bytes to a destination field in this group. If the target field size is longer than the src, all bytes are copied and the remaining bytes in the target field is untouched. If the target field size is shorter than the src, the byte array is truncated. If the target field is a raw field, the src is copied as it is with the raw field size adjusted automatically. It is effectively to remove the raw field from the message by setting it to a zero length.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        src - the source array that contains value to be set
        srcOffset - the starting offset of the source array
        length - the length attempted to be set
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that is set. It is minimal between the length and the storage size.

      • adjustSizeForRawField

        void adjustSizeForRawField(Field field,
                           int length)
        Adjust the size of a raw field without modifying its content. If the underlying field is not a raw field, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        field - a raw field
        length - its new length

      • getNumbers

        int getNumbers(Field field,
               java.lang.Number[] dest,
               int destOffset,
               int length)
        Return a number array of this field. The inference generic type needs to be able to hold the returned value. Otherwise a cast exception will be thrown. byte, I8, U8, I16 needs to have a short type at minimal. U16, I32 need to have an int as minimal. U32, I64, U64 requires a long type. Apply this method to other type of fields including constant fields result in an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        dest - the destination array to hold values
        destOffset - the destination array starting offset
        length - max attempted length to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the number of Numbers retrieved. It is the minimal between the length and the available length in the message.

      • setNumbers

        int setNumbers(Field field,
               java.lang.Number[] src,
               int srcOffset,
               int length)
        Set numbers to a destination field in this group. If the target field size is longer than the src, all numbers are copied and the remaining numbers in the target field is untouched. If the target field size is shorter than the src, the number array is truncated. The method is only applicable to a number type of a field. An attempt to set a larger value in a smaller storage place will result in an error that may not be reported.
        Parameters:
        field - the subfield
        src - the source array that contains value to be set
        srcOffset - the starting offset of the source array
        length - the length attempted to be set
        Returns:
        the number of numbers that is set. It is the minimal between the length and the storage size.

      • getU8Array

        int getU8Array(Field field,
               short[] dest,
               int destOffset,
               int length)
        This is an unprotected method to return a short array of a field in this group. This method can only be applied to fields of type U8. However the method does not validate the field type but assumes it is the responsibility of the application. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        dest - the destination array to hold values
        destOffset - the destination array starting offset
        length - max attempted length to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the number of numbers retrieved. It is the minimal between the length and the available length in the message.

                   double[] dest,

      • getEnumName

        java.lang.String getEnumName(Field field)
        This applies to an enum field. The primitive type of the enum field is a number or a char. The method returns the corresponding enum name based upon the value contained in the SBE message. This is a convenient method. For better performance, use a get method to obtain the value of the enum directly. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is not an enum type.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the enum name based upon the value in the sbe message.

      • isSet

        boolean isSet(Field field,
              java.lang.String bitName)
        Test if a bitName is set. Bit name of a choice is defined in the SBE XML. This is a convenient method. For better performance, use a get method to obtain the value of the choice directly. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if field does not belong to this group or if the field is not a choice type.
        Parameters:
        field - the choice field
        bitName - the bitname defined in the SBE XML for the current choice.
        Returns:
        true if set.

      • getString

        java.lang.String getString(Field field,
                           java.lang.String encodingType)
                    throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        This is applicable to all type of fields. If the field is a number/raw, it returns its string representation. It is not designed for high performance usage. Use getBytes instead.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        encodingType - the encoding type to convert byte array
        Returns:
        the string representation of this field
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding type is not recognized or supported

      • getString

        java.lang.String getString(Field field)
        This is applicable to all type of fields. If the field is a number/raw, it returns its string representation. It uses the platform default charset encoding type. It is not designed for high performance usage. Use getBytes instead.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the string representation of this field

      • getGroupArray

        GroupObjectArray getGroupArray(Field field)
        Obtain a GroupObjectArray. The field has to be a type of GROUP or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        field - the field in this group
        Returns:
        the GroupObjectArray for the corresponding repeating group field.
